May 2021
Since Patch 4.7.0 everything is back to awesome again. It's nice to see, that the Devs really try to make this game work! Best Asymetrical Game out there.


August 2020 
The matchmaking is a total mess - you actually cant play the game anymore :(.

Survivors start to abuse this fact and stop caring about the outcome of the Game.

Disconnects, unsafe Plays, intentional playin with the Killer. Right now only 20% of the games are kind of balanced and without any matchbreaking events. I don't even talk about ingame mechanics which are kind of unblanced by itself.

If you can play with your friends you can still give it a try! It's actually awesome. But dont expect any balancing in this game. It's quite possible that totally new Players will get matched against killers with hundreds hours of playtime.
Me gusta mucho este juego, pero le falta multiplataforma, que se pueda jugar entre diferentes plataformas e incluso con la gente de m√≥vil aunque sea con partidas personalizadas.

It's a really fun game after you stopped getting spooked for awhile :D Especially playing with friends! If you're playing solo do keep in mind that you might stumble across a toxic player but I mostly had fun playing this.

You don't notice at low level ranks because nobody really knows what they're doing, but once you hit mid-game you start to really see the pay-to-win mechanics. Only way to stay competitive is to stay flush with cash, dlc killers and survivors give you such a massive advantage over base game content that you're better off not buying the game unless you're looking to buy everything.

Dead by Daylight is best described as a great gaming premise with so much baggage that you sometimes ponder the worth of playing it at all anymore. You play in a team of 4 survivors repairing generators which will power 2 doors that you can open and escape out of, all the while one out of a myriad of killers is there to kill or sacrifice you to a malicious entity. Amazing concept, really. This is what drew me in to playing over 150 hours. But is the game worth it when almost 50% every match seems to be unforgiving toxicity from killers and the survivor team alike, or matchmaking that is so unfair that I've seen the lowest rank of killer and survivor get matched up with the top quarter of players from either side. I think of Dead by Daylight's culture is one where there is nothing governing it. Everybody is just doing whatever the hell they want. The development team can keep pushing out this awesome new content with a cool new killer and map, but never seem to actually go back and look at how their game plays, even when there are popular complaints spanning years back that still have yet to be addressed.
I commend Behaviour for their awesome game, really. Even all admit that I will probably go back and play it today. The problem is not their game though, and I made that very clear. I fear that most people new to this game will not last long at all, especially considering the state of matchmaking hell it has been in recently. It does not seem to warrant new players, because they let a toxic community have such a big impact already. I definitely do not recommend this game to new players, but if you still want to play Dead by daylight, I suggest to give it a lot of patience. It has taken me hours on some days to get that one match that I would actually consider fair and fun, but damn if that match isn't an amazing gaming experience.
